title: I am a twenty one year old Nigerian, I dropped out of school in my final year, I do not know what to do with my life, I do not have passion for anything what can I do? - Quora

response.answer_text: Start working with any kind of legal and morally acceptable job you find in your country. Here is what you will know. Your true calling or passion in life.The value of education.Professions that are more respected, paid well, and give good quality of life.To reassess your life after spending some time in the mundane work environment.To be thankful for the loving family and friends who have supported you all along. May be you could do them a favor by doing something for them or someone you love.To gain a fresh perspective of life.To know the importance of school and what it can do to transform your life for the best.You may get a great business idea. Who knows what life has in store for you? You are too young and can set an aim for your life.Also try to reading books like What Color Is Your Parachute? 2017: A Practical Manual for Job-Hunters and Career-Changers: Richard N. Bolles: 9780399578205: Amazon.com: Books to know your true passion in life. Hope this helps answer your question.

The answer is quite straightforward if you walk it backwards. Discovering your passion is a lifelong quest.To succeed in this quest you'll need to survive long enough to try out many interests.To survive long enough you'll need to make enough money to keep you going.To make enough money you'll need to get a decent job that guarantees you a recurring salary.To get a decent job in Nigeria you'll need a good degree and great grades.To earn a good degree you'll need to go back to school and finish what you started.You need to explore many interests to truly discover your passion. You can't do that as a broke unemployed Nigerian. Nigeria is too unforgiving for folks that go down that route. Get that degree!
